fields.name: Goblin King
fields.text: Other Goblins get +1/+1 and have mountainwalk.
fields.flavor: To become king of the Goblins, one must assassinate the previous king. Thus, only the most foolish seek positions of leadership.

fields.name: Festering Goblin
fields.text: When Festering Goblin dies, target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
fields.flavor: In life, it was a fetid, disease-ridden thing. In death, not much changed.

fields.name: Firebreathing
fields.text:
Enchant creature
{R}: Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
fields.flavor:
"Magic's only part of it, my friend. Diet does the rest."
—Suq'Ata trader

fields.name: Elvish Archers
fields.text: First strike
fields.flavor: I tell you, there was so many arrows flying about you couldn't hardly see the sun. So I says to young Angus, "Well, at least now we're fighting in the shade!"

fields.name: Swords to Plowshares

fields.name: Caltrops
fields.text: Whenever a creature attacks, Caltrops deals 1 damage to it.

fields.name: Iron Star

fields.name: Greed
fields.text: {B}, Pay 2 life: Draw a card.

"There is no calamity greater than lavish desires. There is no greater guilt than discontentment. And there is no greater disaster than greed."
—Lao Tsu, *Tao Te Ching*, (trans. Chan)

fields.name: Foot Soldiers
fields.flavor: Infantry deployment is the art of putting your troops in the wrong place at the right time.

fields.name: Treefolk Seedlings

fields.flavor:
Even the grandest forest begins with a single seedling.
—Llanowar saying

fields.name: Opportunity

fields.flavor:
Little things like morals shouldn't hinder one's ambition.

fields.name: Rootwalla
fields.text: {1}{G}: Rootwalla gets +2/+2 until end of turn. Activate only once each turn.
fields.flavor: If you try to sneak up on a rootwalla, you'll suddenly find yourself dealing with twice the lizard.

fields.name: Trained Orgg
fields.flavor:
"That arm's for bashin'. That one's for smashin'. That one's for scratchin'. And that one . . . I don't know what that one's for."

Flying

Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
{B}: Vampire Bats gets +1/+0 until end of turn. Activate no more than twice each turn.

At the beginning of each end step, put a corpse counter on Scavenging Ghoul for each creature that died this turn.
Remove a corpse counter from Scavenging Ghoul: Regenerate Scavenging Ghoul.

Defender (This creature can't attack.)

fields.text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)

fields.text:
When Delusions of Mediocrity enters the battlefield, you gain 10 life.

fields.flavor: When nothing but second best will do.

fields.name: Bog Wraith
fields.text: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
fields.flavor: The bodies of its victims are the only tracks it leaves.

fields.text:
Enchant creature

"Today there is feasting and peace across our land, but the war has not ended. Tuck away your bloodlust. You'll need it tomorrow."

Mana Vault doesn't untap during your untap step.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may pay {4}. If you do, untap Mana Vault.

fields.text: Counter target spell. Untap up to four lands.

fields.name: Craw Giant
fields.text:
Trample
Rampage 2 (Whenever this creature becomes blocked, it gets +2/+2 until end of turn for each creature blocking it beyond the first.)

fields.name: Wall of Fire
fields.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{R}: Wall of Fire gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
fields.flavor: Conjured from the bowels of hell, the fiery wall forms an impassable barrier, searing the soul of any creature attempting to pass through its terrible bursts of flame.

fields.name: Longbow Archer
fields.text: First strike; reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)

fields.name: Giant Spider
fields.text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)

"When I trained under Multani, he bade me sit for hours watching Yavimaya's spiders. From them I learned stealth, patience, and the best way to snare a wind drake."
—Mirri of the *Weatherlight*

fields.name: Jade Monolith
fields.text: {1}: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to target creature this turn, that source deals that damage to you instead.

fields.flavor: Legend has it that the mine howls out the last words of those who died inside.

fields.name: Fire Elemental
fields.flavor: Fire Elementals are ruthless infernos, annihilating and consuming their foes in a frenzied holocaust. Crackling and blazing, they sear swift, terrible paths, leaving the land charred and scorched in their wake.

fields.name: Timber Wolves
fields.text: Banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
fields.flavor: Though many think of Wolves as solitary predators, they are actually extremely social animals. During a hunt they often call to each other, which can be quite unsettling for their prey.

fields.name: Lord of Atlantis
fields.text: Other Merfolk get +1/+1 and have islandwalk. (They can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)

"'We have no legs,' the warrior spat, 'for we have finished running.'"

fields.name: Coral Helm

fields.name: Air Elemental

fields.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, destroy all artifacts and enchantments. They can't be regenerated.
fields.flavor:
"Just think of me as the storm before the calm."
—Gerrard of the *Weatherlight*

fields.name: Phantasmal Terrain
fields.text:
Enchant land
As Phantasmal Terrain enters the battlefield, choose a basic land type.
Enchanted land is the chosen type.

fields.name: Coastal Piracy
fields.text: Whenever a creature you control deals combat damage to an opponent, you may draw a card.
fields.flavor: "I don't like to think of myself as a pirate. I'm more like a stimulator of the local economy."

fields.name: Dancing Scimitar
fields.text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
fields.flavor: Bobbing merrily from opponent to opponent, the scimitar began adding playful little flourishes to its strokes; it even turned a couple of somersaults.

fields.name: Lead Golem
fields.text: Whenever Lead Golem attacks, it doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.
fields.flavor: Slow and heavy swings the club.

fields.name: Goblin King
fields.text: Other Goblins get +1/+1 and have mountainwalk.
fields.flavor: To be king, Numsgil did in Blog, who did in Unkful, who did in Viddle, who did in Loll, who did in Alrok. . . .

fields.name: Yavimaya Coast
fields.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{T}: Add {G} or {U}. Yavimaya Coast deals 1 damage to you.

fields.name: Balduvian Barbarians
fields.flavor:
"From the snowy slopes of Kaelor, To the canyons of Bandu, We drink and fight and feast and die As we were born to do."
—Balduvian tavern song

fields.name: Circle of Protection: Green
fields.text: {1}: The next time a green source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

fields.name: Horseshoe Crab
fields.text: {U}: Untap Horseshoe Crab.
fields.flavor:
"Hmm . . . It looks kinda like a bug. Let's crack it open an' see if it tastes like one!"
—Squee, goblin cabin hand

fields.name: Savannah Lions
fields.flavor: The traditional kings of the jungle command a healthy respect in other climates as well. Relying mainly on their stealth and speed, Savannah Lions can take a victim by surprise, even in the endless, flat plains of their homeland.

fields.name: Worldly Tutor
fields.text: Search your library for a creature card, reveal it, then shuffle and put the card on top.
fields.flavor:
"Aselbo soon had the rhino eating from his palm and the snake waiting at his heels."
—Afari, *Tales*

fields.name: Agonizing Memories
fields.text: Look at target player's hand and choose two cards from it. Put them on top of that player's library in any order.
fields.flavor: In the aftermath of war, when the slaying is long done, the greatest miseries come home to roost.

fields.name: Nafs Asp
fields.text: Whenever Nafs Asp deals damage to a player, that player loses 1 life at the beginning of their next draw step unless they pay {1} before that draw step.

fields.name: Sift
fields.text: Draw three cards, then discard a card.
fields.flavor: Dwell longest on the thoughts that shine brightest.

fields.name: Animate Dead
fields.text:
Enchant creature card in a graveyard
When Animate Dead enters the battlefield, if it's on the battlefield, it loses "enchant creature card in a graveyard" and gains "enchant creature put onto the battlefield with Animate Dead." Return enchanted creature card to the battlefield under your control and attach Animate Dead to it. When Animate Dead leaves the battlefield, that creature's controller sacrifices it.
Enchanted creature gets -1/-0.

fields.name: Fugitive Wizard
fields.flavor:
"The law has its place—as a footnote in my spellbook."
—Siyani, fugitive mage

fields.name: Zephyr Falcon
fields.text: Flying, vigilance
fields.flavor: Although greatly prized among falconers, the Zephyr Falcon is capricious and not easily tamed.

fields.name: Word of Blasting
fields.text: Destroy target Wall. It can't be regenerated. Word of Blasting deals damage equal to that Wall's mana value to the Wall's controller.
fields.flavor:
"Walls? What walls?"
—Jaya Ballard, task mage

fields.name: Warp Artifact
fields.text:
Enchant artifact
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted artifact's controller, Warp Artifact deals 1 damage to that player.

fields.name: Suntail Hawk
fields.text: Flying
fields.flavor: Its eye the glaring sun, its cry the keening wind.

fields.name: Black Knight
fields.text:
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
Protection from white (This creature can't be blocked, targeted, dealt damage, or enchanted by anything white.)
fields.flavor: Battle doesn't need a purpose; the battle is its own purpose. You don't ask why a plague spreads or a field burns. Don't ask why I fight.

fields.name: Ice Floe
fields.text:
You may choose not to untap Ice Floe during your untap step.
{T}: Tap target creature without flying that's attacking you. It doesn't untap during its controller's untap step for as long as Ice Floe remains tapped.

fields.name: Consecrate Land
fields.text:
Enchant land
Enchanted land has indestructible and can't be enchanted by other Auras.

fields.name: Badlands
fields.text: ({T}: Add {B} or {R}.)

fields.name: Red Elemental Blast
fields.text:
Choose one —
• Counter target blue spell.
• Destroy target blue permanent.

fields.name: Circle of Protection: Blue
fields.text: {1}: The next time a blue source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

fields.name: True Believer
fields.text: You have shroud. (You can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
fields.flavor: So great is his certainty that mere facts cannot shake it.

fields.name: Greed
fields.text: {B}, Pay 2 life: Draw a card.
fields.flavor: An advisor once asked the Western Paladin how much gold would be enough. "I have no need of fools who can imagine 'enough,'" he told the advisor's corpse.

fields.name: Lightning Blast
fields.text: Lightning Blast deals 4 damage to any target.
fields.flavor:
"Those who fear the darkness have never seen what the light can do."
—Selenia, dark angel

fields.name: Flowstone Crusher
fields.text: {R}: Flowstone Crusher gets +1/-1 until end of turn.
fields.flavor:
"What's better than smashing things with a rock? A rock that gets up and smashes things for you."
—Toggo, goblin weaponsmith

fields.name: Merfolk Looter
fields.text: {T}: Draw a card, then discard a card.
fields.flavor:
It belongs to the merfolk now.
—Shipwreck prayer

fields.name: Ironclaw Orcs
fields.text: Ironclaw Orcs can't block creatures with power 2 or greater.
fields.flavor: Generations of genetic weeding have given rise to the deviously cowardly Ironclaw clan.

fields.name: Gorilla Chieftain
fields.text: {1}{G}: Regenerate Gorilla Chieftain.
fields.flavor: A gorilla chief must always be prepared to defend his crown. This leads to some pretty tough apes.

fields.name: Gang of Elk
fields.text: Whenever Gang of Elk becomes blocked, it gets +2/+2 until end of turn for each creature blocking it.
fields.flavor:
"I felt the ground shake, so I hid in my tent until the earthquake passed. It passed all right, and it left hoofprints."
—Femeref explorer

fields.name: Grizzly Bears
fields.flavor: Don't try to outrun one of Dominaria's grizzlies; it'll catch you, knock you down, and eat you. Of course, you could run up a tree. In that case you'll get a nice view before it knocks the tree down and eats you.

fields.name: Platinum Angel
fields.text:
Flying
You can't lose the game and your opponents can't win the game.
fields.flavor: In its heart lies the secret of immortality.

fields.name: Game of Chaos
fields.text: Flip a coin. If you win the flip, you gain 1 life and target opponent loses 1 life, and you decide whether to flip again. If you lose the flip, you lose 1 life and that opponent gains 1 life, and that player decides whether to flip again. Double the life stakes with each flip.

fields.name: Radjan Spirit
fields.text: {T}: Target creature loses flying until end of turn.

fields.name: Worship
fields.text: If you control a creature, damage that would reduce your life total to less than 1 reduces it to 1 instead.
fields.flavor:
"Believe in the ideal, not the idol."
—Serra

fields.name: Goblin Chariot
fields.text: Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
fields.flavor: The hardest part of his training is learning not to eat the boar.

fields.name: Spellbook
fields.text: You have no maximum hand size.
fields.flavor:
"Everything the wise woman learned she wrote in a book, and when the pages were black with ink, she took white ink and began again."
—Karn, silver golem

fields.name: Spark Elemental
fields.text:
Trample, haste (This creature can deal excess combat damage to the player or planeswalker it's attacking. This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
At the beginning of the end step, sacrifice Spark Elemental.

fields.name: Tundra Wolves
fields.text: First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
fields.flavor: I heard their eerie howling, the wolves calling their kindred across the frozen plains.

fields.name: Hurloon Minotaur
fields.flavor: The Minotaurs of the Hurloon Mountains are known for their love of battle. They are also known for their hymns to the dead, sung for friend and foe alike. These hymns can last for days, filling the mountain valleys with their low, haunting sounds.

fields.name: Rain of Blades
fields.text: Rain of Blades deals 1 damage to each attacking creature.
fields.flavor: Some say they are the weapons of heroes fallen in battle, eager for one last chance at glory.

fields.name: Sengir Vampire
fields.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Whenever a creature dealt damage by Sengir Vampire this turn dies, put a +1/+1 counter on Sengir Vampire.
fields.flavor: Empires rise and fall, but evil is eternal.

fields.name: Breeding Pit
fields.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Breeding Pit unless you pay {B}{B}.
At the beginning of your end step, create a 0/1 black Thrull creature token.
fields.flavor: The thrulls bred at a terrifying pace. In the end, they overwhelmed the Order of the Ebon Hand.

fields.name: Wall of Air
fields.text: Defender, flying (This creature can't attack, and it can block creatures with flying.)
fields.flavor:
When no falcons fly, beware the sky.
—Femeref aphorism

fields.name: Phyrexian Colossus
fields.text:
Phyrexian Colossus doesn't untap during your untap step.
Pay 8 life: Untap Phyrexian Colossus.
Phyrexian Colossus can't be blocked except by three or more creatures.

fields.name: Titania's Song
fields.text: Each noncreature artifact loses all abilities and becomes an artifact creature with power and toughness each equal to its mana value. If Titania's Song leaves the battlefield, this effect continues until end of turn.

fields.name: Dingus Egg
fields.text: Whenever a land is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, Dingus Egg deals 2 damage to that land's controller.

fields.name: Crimson Manticore
fields.text:
Flying
{R}, {T}: Crimson Manticore deals 1 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.
fields.flavor: Noted neither for their good looks nor their charm, Manticores can be fearsome allies. As dinner companions, however, they are best left alone.

fields.name: Telepathy
fields.text: Your opponents play with their hands revealed.
fields.flavor: "Secrets? What secrets?"

fields.name: Clone
fields.text: You may have Clone enter the battlefield as a copy of any creature on the battlefield.

fields.name: Regeneration
fields.text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
{G}: Regenerate enchanted creature. (The next time that creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)

fields.name: Doubling Cube
fields.text: {3}, {T}: Double the amount of each type of unspent mana you have.
fields.flavor: The cube's surface is pockmarked with jagged runes that seem to shift when unobserved.

fields.name: Stasis
fields.text:
Players skip their untap steps.
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Stasis unless you pay {U}.

fields.name: Mind Warp
fields.text: Look at target player's hand and choose X cards from it. That player discards those cards.
fields.flavor: The hardest of wizards can have the softest of minds.

fields.name: Storm Shaman
fields.text: {R}: Storm Shaman gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
fields.flavor: She speaks with the voice of the winds, and the earth trembles.

fields.name: Power Leak
fields.text:
Enchant enchantment
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted enchantment's controller, that player may pay any amount of mana. Power Leak deals 2 damage to that player. Prevent X of that damage, where X is the amount of mana that player paid this way.

fields.name: Ethereal Champion
fields.text: Pay 1 life: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to Ethereal Champion this turn.
fields.flavor:
"If I have learned anything as a wizard it is this: never fight your own battles."
—Waffa, sorcerer of Nyomba

fields.name: Doomed Necromancer
fields.text: {B}, {T}, Sacrifice Doomed Necromancer: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
fields.flavor: Many necromancers share the same last words—the ones that conclude the undeath ritual.

fields.name: Disorder
fields.text: Disorder deals 2 damage to each white creature and each player who controls a white creature.
fields.flavor:
"Fire hurts them almost as much as the chaos that follows. Almost."
—The Western Paladin

fields.name: Spineless Thug
fields.text: Spineless Thug can't block.
fields.flavor: What it lacks in backbone, it makes up for in cruelty.

fields.name: Hunted Wumpus
fields.text: When Hunted Wumpus enters the battlefield, each other player may put a creature card from their hand onto the battlefield.
fields.flavor: Just one can feed a dozen people for a month.

fields.name: Tranquility
fields.text: Destroy all enchantments.

fields.name: Deathlace
fields.text: Target spell or permanent becomes black. (Mana symbols on that permanent remain unchanged.)

fields.name: Stream of Life
fields.text: Target player gains X life.

fields.name: Craw Wurm
fields.flavor: The most terrifying thing about the craw wurm is probably the horrible crashing sound it makes as it speeds through the forest. This noise is so loud it echoes through the trees and seems to come from all directions at once.

fields.name: Disrupting Scepter
fields.text: {3}, {T}: Target player discards a card. Activate only during your turn.

fields.name: Sea Serpent
fields.text:
Sea Serpent can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.
When you control no Islands, sacrifice Sea Serpent.
fields.flavor: Legend has it that Serpents used to be bigger, but how could that be?

fields.name: Legacy Weapon
fields.text:
{W}{U}{B}{R}{G}: Exile target permanent.
If Legacy Weapon would be put into a graveyard from anywhere, reveal Legacy Weapon and shuffle it into its owner's library instead.

fields.name: Enrage
fields.text: Target creature gets +X/+0 until end of turn.
fields.flavor: "You wouldn't like me when I'm angry."

fields.name: Bog Imp
fields.text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
fields.flavor: Think of it as a butcher knife with wings.

fields.name: Lava Axe
fields.text: Lava Axe deals 5 damage to target player or planeswalker.
fields.flavor: "Catch!"

fields.name: Time Stop
fields.text: End the turn. (Exile all spells and abilities from the stack, including this card. The player whose turn it is discards down to their maximum hand size. Damage wears off, and "this turn" and "until end of turn" effects end.)

fields.name: Ray of Command
fields.text: Untap target creature an opponent controls and gain control of it until end of turn. That creature gains haste until end of turn. When you lose control of the creature, tap it.

fields.name: Kraken's Eye
fields.text: Whenever a player casts a blue spell, you may gain 1 life.
fields.flavor: Bright as a mirror, dark as the sea.

fields.name: Ornithopter
fields.text: Flying
fields.flavor:
"It has been my honor to improve on the Thran's original design. Perhaps history will remember me in some small part for my work."
—Urza, in his apprenticeship

fields.name: Fog
fields.text: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.

fields.name: Birds of Paradise
fields.text:
Flying
{T}: Add one mana of any color.

fields.name: Circle of Protection: Green
fields.text: {1}: The next time a green source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

fields.name: Mystic Compass
fields.text: {1}, {T}: Target land becomes the basic land type of your choice until end of turn.

fields.name: Earth Elemental
fields.flavor: Earth elementals have the eternal strength of stone and the endurance of mountains. Primordially connected to the land they inhabit, they take a long-term view of things, scorning the impetuous haste of short-lived mortal creatures.

fields.name: Illicit Auction
fields.text: Each player may bid life for control of target creature. You start the bidding with a bid of 0. In turn order, each player may top the high bid. The bidding ends if the high bid stands. The high bidder loses life equal to the high bid and gains control of the creature. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)

fields.name: Seeker
fields.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or white creatures.

fields.name: Animate Wall
fields.text:
Enchant Wall
Enchanted Wall can attack as though it didn't have defender.
fields.flavor:
"When you have been bitten with fangs of granite, you start to long for the ivory sabers of tigers."
—Norin the Wary

fields.name: Prodigal Sorcerer
fields.text: {T}: Prodigal Sorcerer deals 1 damage to any target.
fields.flavor: Occasionally a member of the Institute of Arcane Study acquires a taste for worldly pleasures. Seldom do they have trouble finding employment.

fields.name: Hate Weaver
fields.text: {2}: Target blue or red creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
fields.flavor: "Let my hate fuel your fury."

fields.name: Razortooth Rats
fields.text: Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
fields.flavor:
"Men and rats both hunger: we for our playthings; they, for us."
—Crovax

fields.name: Brainwash
fields.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack unless its controller pays {3}.
fields.flavor: "They're not your friends; they despise you. I'm the only one you can count on. Trust me."

fields.name: Treetop Bracers
fields.text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 and can't be blocked except by creatures with flying.
fields.flavor: Gravity is truly what you make of it.

fields.name: The Hive
fields.text: {5}, {T}: Create a 1/1 colorless Insect artifact creature token with flying named Wasp. (It can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)

fields.name: Pacifism
fields.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack or block.
fields.flavor: For the first time in his life, Grakk felt a little warm and fuzzy inside.

fields.name: Sea Eagle
fields.text: Flying
fields.flavor: Where air meets water, fish meets talon.

fields.name: Vampire Bats
fields.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
{B}: Vampire Bats gets +1/+0 until end of turn. Activate no more than twice each turn.

fields.name: Stronghold Discipline
fields.text: Each player loses 1 life for each creature they control.
fields.flavor: In Urborg, the instigators of each new rebellion are soaked in the blood of the last.

fields.name: Manabarbs
fields.text: Whenever a player taps a land for mana, Manabarbs deals 1 damage to that player.

fields.name: Mind Ravel
fields.text:
Target player discards a card.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
fields.flavor: An end to reason, an end to order. Forget all that has been.

fields.name: Mortivore
fields.text:
Mortivore's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creature cards in all graveyards.
{B}: Regenerate Mortivore.
fields.flavor: The light sigh of its breath whistles through its bones.

fields.name: Stone Rain
fields.text: Destroy target land.

fields.name: Feldon's Cane
fields.text: {T}, Exile Feldon's Cane: Shuffle your graveyard into your library.
fields.flavor: Feldon found the first of these canes frozen in the Ronom Glacier.

fields.name: Savannah
fields.text: ({T}: Add {G} or {W}.)

fields.name: Mischievous Poltergeist
fields.text:
Flying
Pay 1 life: Regenerate Mischievous Poltergeist.
fields.flavor:
"The past is a ghost that haunts you from the moment it exists until the moment you don't."
—Gerrard of the *Weatherlight*

fields.name: Booby Trap
fields.text:
As Booby Trap enters the battlefield, choose an opponent and a card name other than a basic land card name.
The chosen player reveals each card they draw.
When the chosen player draws a card with the chosen name, sacrifice Booby Trap. If you do, Booby Trap deals 10 damage to that player.

fields.name: Teferi's Puzzle Box
fields.text: At the beginning of each player's draw step, that player puts the cards in their hand on the bottom of their library in any order, then draws that many cards.

fields.name: Spell Blast
fields.text: Counter target spell with mana value X. (For example, if that spell's mana cost is {3}{U}{U}, X is 5.)

fields.name: Suntail Hawk
fields.text: Flying
fields.flavor: Its eye the glaring sun, its cry the keening wind.

fields.name: Manabarbs
fields.text: Whenever a player taps a land for mana, Manabarbs deals 1 damage to that player.

fields.name: Razortooth Rats
fields.text: Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
fields.flavor:
"Men and rats both hunger: we for our playthings; they, for us."
—Crovax, ascendant evincar

fields.name: Living Lands
fields.text: All Forests are 1/1 creatures that are still lands.

fields.name: Might of Oaks
fields.text: Target creature gets +7/+7 until end of turn.
fields.flavor: "Guess where I'm gonna plant this!"

fields.name: Titania's Song
fields.text: Each noncreature artifact loses all abilities and becomes an artifact creature with power and toughness each equal to its mana value. If Titania's Song leaves the battlefield, this effect continues until end of turn.

fields.name: Bloodfire Colossus
fields.text: {R}, Sacrifice Bloodfire Colossus: It deals 6 damage to each creature and each player.
fields.flavor: It took all its strength to contain the fire within.

fields.name: Ornithopter
fields.text: Flying
fields.flavor: Many scholars believe that these creatures were the result of Urza's first attempt at mechanical life, perhaps created in his early days as an apprentice to Tocasia.

fields.name: Recollect
fields.text: Return target card from your graveyard to your hand.
fields.flavor:
"The bones of the past will tell their tales—if you know how to speak their language."
—Savra

fields.name: Ambush Party
fields.text: First strike, haste
fields.flavor:
"Fair fight? I'll take survival over chivalry any day!"
—Tor Wauki, Bandit King

fields.name: Fastbond
fields.text:
You may play any number of lands on each of your turns.

fields.name: Magus of the Unseen
fields.text: {1}{U}, {T}: Untap target artifact an opponent controls and gain control of it until end of turn. It gains haste until end of turn. When you lose control of the artifact, tap it.

fields.name: Psychic Transfer
fields.text: If the difference between your life total and target player's life total is 5 or less, exchange life totals with that player.
fields.flavor:
"The memory of your existence will fade like the final stars of morning."
—Kaervek

fields.name: Holy Strength
fields.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+2.

fields.name: Treetop Village
fields.text:
Treetop Village enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {G}.
{1}{G}: Treetop Village becomes a 3/3 green Ape creature with trample until end of turn. It's still a land. (It can deal excess combat damage to the player or planeswalker it's attacking.)

fields.name: Pincher Beetles
fields.text: Shroud (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
fields.flavor:
"No fair Since when does a bug get ta munch on *me*?"
—Squee, goblin cabin hand

fields.name: Healing Salve
fields.text:
Choose one —
• Target player gains 3 life.
• Prevent the next 3 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn.

fields.name: Spirit Link
fields.text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Whenever enchanted creature deals damage, you gain that much life.
fields.flavor: "I am bound to all my children. I share in their joys, I rage at their injuries."

fields.name: Treetop Village
fields.text:
Treetop Village enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {G}.
{1}{G}: Treetop Village becomes a 3/3 green Ape creature with trample until end of turn. It's still a land. (It can deal excess combat damage to the player or planeswalker it's attacking.)

fields.name: Millstone
fields.text: {2}, {T}: Target player mills two cards.
fields.flavor: More than one mage was driven insane by the sound of the Millstone relentlessly grinding away.

fields.name: Urza's Bauble

fields.name: Clay Statue
fields.text: {2}: Regenerate Clay Statue.
fields.flavor: Tawnos won fame as Urza's greatest assistant. After he created these warriors, Urza ended his apprenticeship, promoting him directly to the rank of master.

Enchant creature

"Visions of glory, spare my aching sight,

—Thomas Gray, "The Bard"

Choose one —
• Counter target blue spell.

fields.name: Stone Spirit
fields.text: Stone Spirit can't be blocked by creatures with flying.
fields.flavor:
"The spirit of the stone is the spirit of strength."
—Lovisa Coldeyes, Balduvian chieftain

fields.name: Reminisce
fields.text: Target player shuffles their graveyard into their library.
fields.flavor: Leave the door to the past even slightly ajar and it could be blown off its hinges.

fields.name: Confiscate
fields.text:
Enchant permanent
You control enchanted permanent.
fields.flavor:
"It is better to take what does not belong to you than to let it lie around neglected."
—Mark Twain, *More Maxims of Mark*

fields.name: Sanctimony
fields.text: Whenever an opponent taps a Mountain for mana, you may gain 1 life.
fields.flavor: "The peasants labor for my profit. I approve."

fields.name: Urza's Power Plant
fields.text: {T}: Add {C}. If you control an Urza's Mine and an Urza's Tower, add {C}{C} instead.

fields.name: Thicket Basilisk
fields.text: Whenever Thicket Basilisk blocks or becomes blocked by a non-Wall creature, destroy that creature at end of combat.
fields.flavor: Moss-covered statues littered the area, a macabre monument to the basilisk's terrible power.

fields.name: Cloud Elemental
fields.text:
Flying
Cloud Elemental can block only creatures with flying.
fields.flavor: The soratami surround their sky-castles with living clouds that serve as both sword and shield.

fields.name: Final Punishment
fields.text: Target player loses life equal to the damage already dealt to that player this turn.
fields.flavor: The pain of a lifetime—every scrape, illness, and bruise—condensed into a single moment.

fields.name: Wall of Swords
fields.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Flying
fields.flavor: The air hummed with the scissoring sound of uncounted blades that hovered in front of the invaders as though wielded by a phalanx of unseen hands.

fields.name: Fishliver Oil
fields.text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature has islandwalk. (It can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)

fields.name: Ashnod's Transmogrant
fields.text: {T}, Sacrifice Ashnod's Transmogrant: Put a +1/+1 counter on target nonartifact creature. That creature becomes an artifact in addition to its other types.
fields.flavor: Ashnod found few willing to trade their humanity for the power she offered.

fields.name: Master Healer
fields.text: {T}: Prevent the next 4 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn.
fields.flavor: Behind his eyes is the pain of every soldier his hands have healed.

fields.name: Samite Healer
fields.text: {T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn.
fields.flavor: Why does a Samite heal? You might as well ask why a bird flies.

fields.name: Primal Clay
fields.text: As Primal Clay enters the battlefield, it becomes your choice of a 3/3 artifact creature, a 2/2 artifact creature with flying, or a 1/6 Wall artifact creature with defender in addition to its other types. (A creature with defender can't attack.)

fields.name: Clockwork Steed
fields.text:
Clockwork Steed enters the battlefield with four +1/+0 counters on it.
Clockwork Steed can't be blocked by artifact creatures.
At end of combat, if Clockwork Steed attacked or blocked this combat, remove a +1/+0 counter from it.
{X}, {T}: Put up to X +1/+0 counters on Clockwork Steed. This ability can't cause the total number of +1/+0 counters on Clockwork Steed to be greater than four. Activate only during your upkeep.

fields.name: Flying Carpet
fields.text: {2}, {T}: Target creature gains flying until end of turn.
fields.flavor: Woven from strands of griffin mane and pegasus tail.

fields.name: Gorilla Chieftain
fields.text: {1}{G}: Regenerate Gorilla Chieftain.
fields.flavor:
"In the soil of leadership sprout the seeds of immortality."
—Kaysa, Elder Druid of the Juniper

fields.name: Ironroot Treefolk
fields.flavor: The mating habits of Treefolk, particularly the stalwart Ironroot Treefolk, are truly absurd. Molasses comes to mind. It's amazing the species can survive at all given such protracted periods of mate selection, conjugation, and gestation.

fields.name: Lord of the Pit
fields.text:
Flying, trample
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice a creature other than Lord of the Pit. If you can't, Lord of the Pit deals 7 damage to you.

fields.name: Dakmor Lancer
fields.text: When Dakmor Lancer enters the battlefield, destroy target nonblack creature.
fields.flavor: The darkness of his shield reflects the inky blackness of his soul.

fields.name: Flight
fields.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has flying.

fields.name: Llanowar Elves
fields.text: {T}: Add {G}.
fields.flavor:
One bone broken for every twig snapped underfoot.
—Llanowar penalty for trespassing

fields.name: Anaba Bodyguard
fields.text: First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
fields.flavor:
"They who challenge a minotaur enjoy the taste of their own blood."
—Mirri of the *Weatherlight*

fields.name: Boiling Seas
fields.text: Destroy all Islands.
fields.flavor: What burns the land, boils the seas.

fields.name: Caves of Koilos
fields.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{T}: Add {W} or {B}. Caves of Koilos deals 1 damage to you.

fields.name: Grizzly Bears
fields.flavor: Don't try to outrun one of Dominaria's grizzlies; it'll catch you, knock you down, and eat you. Of course, you could run up a tree. In that case you'll get a nice view before it knocks the tree down and eats you.

fields.name: Coat of Arms
fields.text: Each creature gets +1/+1 for each other creature on the battlefield that shares at least one creature type with it. (For example, if two Goblin Warriors and a Goblin Shaman are on the battlefield, each gets +2/+2.)
fields.flavor:
"Hup, two, three, four,
Dunno how to count no more."

fields.name: Pyroclasm
fields.text: Pyroclasm deals 2 damage to each creature.
fields.flavor:
"When the air burns, only death breathes deep."
—Bogardan mage

fields.name: Thieving Magpie
fields.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Whenever Thieving Magpie deals damage to an opponent, draw a card.
fields.flavor: Other birds collect twigs for their nests. Magpies steal jewels for theirs.

fields.name: Dread of Night
fields.text: White creatures get -1/-1.
fields.flavor:
"These moonless, foreign skies keep me in thrall. Dark whispers echo in the night, and I cannot resist."
—Selenia, dark angel

fields.name: Upwelling
fields.text: Players don't lose unspent mana as steps and phases end.
fields.flavor: Freyalise promised a dawn that would never end, a day of limitless life. As many dread her promise as revere it.

fields.name: Mortivore
fields.text:
Mortivore's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creature cards in all graveyards.
{B}: Regenerate Mortivore.

fields.name: Sea Monster
fields.text: Sea Monster can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.
fields.flavor: It's easy to believe the monster is a myth—until you feel three hundred thousand pounds of myth crashing down on your ship.

fields.name: Sage Owl
fields.text:
Flying
When Sage Owl enters the battlefield, look at the top four cards of your library, then put them back in any order.

fields.name: Lifetap
fields.text: Whenever a Forest an opponent controls becomes tapped, you gain 1 life.

fields.name: Fortified Area
fields.text: Wall creatures you control get +1/+0 and have banding. (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)

fields.name: Telepathy
fields.text: Your opponents play with their hands revealed.
fields.flavor: "Secrets? What secrets?"

fields.name: Molimo, Maro-Sorcerer
fields.text:
Trample (This creature can deal excess combat damage to the player or planeswalker it's attacking.)
Molimo, Maro-Sorcerer's power and toughness are each equal to the number of lands you control.

fields.name: Sylvan Scrying
fields.text: Search your library for a land card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle.
fields.flavor: One glimpse of an elf's home lasts her weeks away in the wild.

fields.name: Gloom
fields.text:
White spells cost {3} more to cast.
Activated abilities of white enchantments cost {3} more to activate.

fields.name: Phantom Warrior
fields.text: Phantom Warrior can't be blocked.
fields.flavor: It can pass through solid matter—but that doesn't mean it's harmless.

fields.name: Gift of Estates
fields.text: If an opponent controls more lands than you, search your library for up to three Plains cards, reveal them, put them into your hand, then shuffle.

fields.name: Urza's Mine
fields.text: {T}: Add {C}. If you control an Urza's Power-Plant and an Urza's Tower, add {C}{C} instead.
fields.flavor: Mines became common as cities during the days of the artificers.

fields.name: Thundermare
fields.text:
Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
When Thundermare enters the battlefield, tap all other creatures.
fields.flavor: Its hooves strike lightning and the thunder follows quickly after.

fields.name: Wall of Bone
fields.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{B}: Regenerate Wall of Bone. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)
fields.flavor: A skeletal wall, strengthened by the souls of traitors, rings the city of the Eastern Paladin.

fields.name: Regeneration
fields.text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
{G}: Regenerate enchanted creature. (The next time that creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)

fields.name: Blight
fields.text:
Enchant land
When enchanted land becomes tapped, destroy it.

fields.name: Storage Matrix
fields.text: As long as Storage Matrix is untapped, each player chooses artifact, creature, or land during their untap step. That player can untap only permanents of the chosen type this step.

fields.name: Zombie Master
fields.text:
Other Zombie creatures have swampwalk. (They can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
Other Zombies have "{B}: Regenerate this permanent."
fields.flavor: He controlled the zombies even before his own death; now nothing can make them betray him.

fields.name: Raging Goblin
fields.text: Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
fields.flavor: He raged at the world, at his family, at his life. But mostly he just raged.

fields.name: Drudge Skeletons
fields.text: {B}: Regenerate Drudge Skeletons. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)
fields.flavor: Bones scattered around us joined to form misshapen bodies. We struck at them repeatedly—they fell, but soon formed again, with the same mocking look on their faceless skulls.

fields.name: Inspiration
fields.text: Target player draws two cards.
fields.flavor: Madness and genius are separated only by degrees of success.

fields.name: Divine Transformation
fields.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +3/+3.
fields.flavor: Glory surged through her and radiance surrounded her. All things were possible with the blessing of the Divine.

fields.name: Gerrard's Wisdom
fields.text: You gain 2 life for each card in your hand.
fields.flavor: A picture is worth a thousand swords.

fields.name: Shapeshifter
fields.text:
As Shapeshifter enters the battlefield, choose a number between 0 and 7.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may choose a number between 0 and 7.
Shapeshifter's power is equal to the last chosen number and its toughness is equal to 7 minus that number.

fields.name: Unholy Strength
fields.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+1.
fields.flavor: Such power grows the body as it shrinks the soul.

fields.name: Simulacrum
fields.text: You gain life equal to the damage dealt to you this turn. Simulacrum deals damage to target creature you control equal to the damage dealt to you this turn.

fields.name: An-Havva Constable
fields.text: An-Havva Constable's toughness is equal to 1 plus the number of green creatures on the battlefield.
fields.flavor:
"Joskun and the other constables serve with passion, if not with grace."
—Devin, faerie noble

fields.name: Air Elemental
fields.text: Flying
fields.flavor: Where psycho meets cyclone.

fields.name: White Ward
fields.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has protection from white. This effect doesn't remove White Ward.

fields.name: Earthquake
fields.text: Earthquake deals X damage to each creature without flying and each player.

fields.name: Rod of Ruin
fields.text: {3}, {T}: Rod of Ruin deals 1 damage to any target.

fields.name: Plow Under
fields.text: Put two target lands on top of their owners' libraries.
fields.flavor:
To renew the land, plow the land.
To destroy the land, do nothing.
—Druids' saying

fields.name: Glorious Anthem
fields.text: Creatures you control get +1/+1.
fields.flavor: Once heard, the battle song of an angel becomes part of the listener forever.

fields.name: Nether Shadow
fields.text:
Haste
At the beginning of your upkeep, if Nether Shadow is in your graveyard with three or more creature cards above it, you may put Nether Shadow onto the battlefield.

fields.name: Tariff
fields.text: Each player sacrifices the creature they control with the highest mana value unless they pay that creature's mana cost. If two or more creatures a player controls are tied for highest, that player chooses one.

fields.name: Evil Presence
fields.text:
Enchant land
Enchanted land is a Swamp.

fields.name: Winter Orb
fields.text: As long as Winter Orb is untapped, players can't untap more than one land during their untap steps.
fields.flavor:
"When once winter has ahold,
Not willingly does she withdraw
Her icy touch, wistfully caressing—
The deepened air sleeps its cold."
—Aline Corralurn, "Late Thaw"

fields.name: Bog Wraith
fields.text: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
fields.flavor: 'Twas in the bogs of Cannelbrae My mate did meet an early grave; 'Twas nothing left for us to save In the peat-filled bogs of Cannelbrae.

fields.name: Jade Monolith
fields.text: {1}: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to target creature this turn, that source deals that damage to you instead.

fields.name: Cursed Land
fields.text:
Enchant land
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted land's controller, Cursed Land deals 1 damage to that player.

fields.name: Pestilence
fields.text:
At the beginning of the end step, if no creatures are on the battlefield, sacrifice Pestilence.
{B}: Pestilence deals 1 damage to each creature and each player.

fields.name: Wrath of God
fields.text: Destroy all creatures. They can't be regenerated.

fields.name: Fallen Angel
fields.text:
Flying
Sacrifice a creature: Fallen Angel gets +2/+1 until end of turn.
fields.flavor:
"Angels are simply extensions of truth upon the fabric of life—and there is far more dark than light."
—Baron Sengir

fields.name: Beacon of Destruction
fields.text: Beacon of Destruction deals 5 damage to any target. Shuffle Beacon of Destruction into its owner's library.
fields.flavor: The Great Furnace's blessing is a spectacular sight, but the best view comes at a high cost.

fields.name: Sudden Impact
fields.text: Sudden Impact deals damage to target player equal to the number of cards in that player's hand.
fields.flavor:
"Some say it's better to think before you act. While those people are considering all the options, that's usually when I kill them."
—Dravus, lava mage

fields.name: Windborn Muse
fields.text:
Flying
Creatures can't attack you unless their controller pays {2} for each creature they control that's attacking you.
fields.flavor:
"Her voice is justice, clear and relentless."
—Akroma, angelic avenger

fields.name: Giant Growth
fields.text: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.

fields.name: Black Vise
fields.text:
As Black Vise enters the battlefield, choose an opponent.
At the beginning of the chosen player's upkeep, Black Vise deals X damage to that player, where X is the number of cards in their hand minus 4.

fields.name: Eye for an Eye
fields.text: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, instead that source deals that much damage to you and Eye for an Eye deals that much damage to that source's controller.

fields.name: Angelic Blessing
fields.text: Target creature gets +3/+3 and gains flying until end of turn. (It can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
fields.flavor: Only the warrior who can admit mortal weakness will be bolstered by immortal strength.

fields.name: Wall of Air
fields.text: Defender, flying (This creature can't attack, and it can block creatures with flying.)
fields.flavor: "This 'standing windstorm' can hold us off indefinitely? Ridiculous!" Saying nothing, she put a pinch of salt on the table. With a bang she clapped her hands, and the salt disappeared, blown away.

fields.name: Spell Blast
fields.text: Counter target spell with mana value X. (For example, if that spell's mana cost is {3}{U}{U}, X is 5.)

fields.name: Fear
fields.text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature has fear. (It can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
fields.flavor:
"Don't fear the darkness. Fear what it hides."
—Remin, venerable monk

fields.name: Wall of Wood
fields.text: Defender (This creature can't attack.)
fields.flavor: Orcish lumberjacks spent the night sharpening their blades and resting for a day of labor. They awoke to find that the forest had been making its own preparations.

fields.name: Heal
fields.text:
Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
fields.flavor:
"Sometimes even the smallest boon can save a life."
—Halvor Arenson, Kjeldoran priest

fields.name: City of Brass
fields.text:
Whenever City of Brass becomes tapped, it deals 1 damage to you.
{T}: Add one mana of any color.

fields.name: Gaseous Form
fields.text:
Enchant creature
Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to and dealt by enchanted creature.
fields.flavor:
". . . [A]nd gives to airy nothing A local habitation and a name."
—William Shakespeare,
*A Midsummer-Night's Dream*

fields.name: Aladdin's Ring
fields.text: {8}, {T}: Aladdin's Ring deals 4 damage to any target.
fields.flavor:
"A good lamp will light your way. A good ring will clear it."
—Nervan, royal jeweler

fields.name: Enfeeblement
fields.text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature gets -2/-2.
fields.flavor:
"If it is weak, either kill it or ignore it. Anything else honors it."
—Kaervek

fields.name: Warp World
fields.text: Each player shuffles all permanents they own into their library, then reveals that many cards from the top of their library. Each player puts all artifact, creature, and land cards revealed this way onto the battlefield, then does the same for enchantment cards, then puts all cards revealed this way that weren't put onto the battlefield on the bottom of their library.

fields.name: Shivan Dragon
fields.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
{R}: Shivan Dragon gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
fields.flavor: While it's true most Dragons are cruel, the Shivan Dragon seems to take particular glee in the misery of others, often tormenting its victims much like a cat plays with a mouse before delivering the final blow.

fields.name: Demonic Tutor
fields.text: Search your library for a card, put that card into your hand, then shuffle.

fields.name: Orcish Artillery
fields.text: {T}: Orcish Artillery deals 2 damage to any target and 3 damage to you.
fields.flavor:
"So they want to kill my men? Well two can play at that game."
—General Khurzog

fields.name: Mons's Goblin Raiders
fields.flavor: The intricate dynamics of Rundvelt Goblin affairs are often confused with anarchy. The chaos, however, is the chaos of a thundercloud, and direction will sporadically and violently appear. Pashalik Mons and his Raiders are the thunderhead that leads in the storm.

fields.name: Remove Soul
fields.text: Counter target creature spell.
fields.flavor: When your enemies are denied soldiers, they are denied victory.

fields.name: Beacon of Immortality
fields.text: Double target player's life total. Shuffle Beacon of Immortality into its owner's library.
fields.flavor: The cave floods with light. A thousand rays shine forth and meld into one.

fields.name: Firebreathing
fields.text:
Enchant creature
{R}: Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

fields.name: Vicious Hunger
fields.text: Vicious Hunger deals 2 damage to target creature and you gain 2 life.
fields.flavor: Only the most ravenous soul feeds on the health of the weak.

fields.name: Mind Bend
fields.text: Change the text of target permanent by replacing all instances of one color word with another or one basic land type with another. (For example, you may change "nonblack creature" to "nongreen creature" or "forestwalk" to "islandwalk." This effect lasts indefinitely.)

fields.name: Beast of Burden
fields.text: Beast of Burden's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creatures on the battlefield.
fields.flavor: The heavier the load, the harder it works.

fields.name: Ancient Silverback
fields.text: {G}: Regenerate Ancient Silverback. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)

fields.name: Blood Moon
fields.text: Nonbasic lands are Mountains.
fields.flavor: Heavy light flooded across the landscape, cloaking everything in deep crimson.

fields.name: Early Harvest
fields.text: Target player untaps all basic lands they control.
fields.flavor:
"Tonight we'll eat a farewell feast. Cold corn porridge is not enough. / Let's peel papayas, pineapples, and mangoes, drink coconut milk, / and bake bananas."
—"Love Song of Night and Day"

fields.name: Game of Chaos
fields.text: Flip a coin. If you win the flip, you gain 1 life and target opponent loses 1 life, and you decide whether to flip again. If you lose the flip, you lose 1 life and that opponent gains 1 life, and that player decides whether to flip again. Double the life stakes with each flip.

fields.name: White Knight
fields.text:
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
Protection from black (This creature can't be blocked, targeted, dealt damage, or enchanted by anything black.)
fields.flavor: Out of the blackness and stench of the engulfing swamp emerged a shimmering figure. Only the splattered armor and ichor-stained sword hinted at the unfathomable evil the knight had just laid waste.

fields.name: Rampant Growth
fields.text: Search your library for a basic land card, put that card onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle.
fields.flavor: Nature grows solutions to her problems.

fields.name: Angel of Mercy
fields.text:
Flying
When Angel of Mercy enters the battlefield, you gain 3 life.
fields.flavor: Every tear shed is a drop of immortality.

fields.name: Ur-Golem's Eye
fields.text: {T}: Add {C}{C}.
fields.flavor: It still stares accusingly at Memnarch, though millennia have passed since he separated the eye from its body.

fields.name: Elven Riders
fields.text: Elven Riders can't be blocked except by Walls and/or creatures with flying.
fields.flavor:
Sometimes it is better to be swift of foot than strong of swordarm.
—Elven proverb

fields.name: Volcanic Eruption
fields.text: Destroy X target Mountains. Volcanic Eruption deals damage to each creature and each player equal to the number of Mountains put into a graveyard this way.

fields.name: Nausea
fields.text: All creatures get -1/-1 until end of turn.
fields.flavor: No fear. No sense. And soon, no lunch.

fields.name: Jalum Tome
fields.text: {2}, {T}: Draw a card, then discard a card.
fields.flavor: Most books simply deliver knowledge. This one expects some in return.

fields.name: Kjeldoran Skycaptain
fields.text: Flying; first strike; banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
fields.flavor: The heartlink between soldier and steed is hatched with the aesthir struggling from its shell.

fields.name: Wrath of God
fields.text: Destroy all creatures. They can't be regenerated.

fields.name: Salt Marsh
fields.text:
Salt Marsh enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {U} or {B}.
fields.flavor:
Only death breeds in stagnant water.
—Urborg saying

fields.name: Serpent Warrior
fields.text: When Serpent Warrior enters the battlefield, you lose 3 life.
fields.flavor: They're the fiercest of all the Western Paladin's soldiers. They're also the most fiercely loyal—but that loyalty comes at a price.

fields.name: Channel
fields.text: Until end of turn, any time you could activate a mana ability, you may pay 1 life. If you do, add {C}.

fields.name: Murk Dwellers
fields.text: Whenever Murk Dwellers attacks and isn't blocked, it gets +2/+0 until end of combat.
fields.flavor: When Raganorn unsealed the catacombs, he found more than the dead and their treasures.

fields.name: Sever Soul
fields.text: Destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated. You gain life equal to its toughness.
fields.flavor:
"The mortal world is a grove of sweet fruit, and I am ready to harvest it."
—Fallen angel

fields.name: Sandstorm
fields.text: Sandstorm deals 1 damage to each attacking creature.
fields.flavor: Even the landscape turned against Sarsour, first rising up and pelting him, then rearranging itself so he could no longer find his way.

fields.name: Hurkyl's Recall
fields.text: Return all artifacts target player owns to their hand.
fields.flavor: This spell, like many attributed to Drafna, was actually the work of his wife and former student, Hurkyl.

fields.name: Energy Flux
fields.text: All artifacts have "At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice this artifact unless you pay {2}."

fields.name: Rod of Ruin
fields.text: {3}, {T}: Rod of Ruin deals 1 damage to any target.

fields.name: Mahamoti Djinn
fields.text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
fields.flavor: Of royal blood among the spirits of the air, the Mahamoti Djinn rides on the wings of the winds. As dangerous in the gambling hall as he is in battle, he is a master of trickery and misdirection.

fields.name: Howl from Beyond
fields.text: Target creature gets +X/+0 until end of turn.

fields.name: Natural Selection
fields.text: Look at the top three cards of target player's library, then put them back in any order. You may have that player shuffle.

fields.name: Circle of Protection: Blue
fields.text: {1}: The next time a blue source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

fields.name: Wind Spirit
fields.text:
Flying
Menace (This creature can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)
fields.flavor:
" . . . [W]hen the trees bow down their heads, / The wind is passing by."
—Christina Rossetti,
"Who Has Seen the Wind?"

fields.name: Lone Wolf
fields.text: You may have Lone Wolf assign its combat damage as though it weren't blocked.
fields.flavor: A wolf without a pack is either a survivor or a brute.

fields.name: Mana Clash
fields.text: You and target opponent each flip a coin. Mana Clash deals 1 damage to each player whose coin comes up tails. Repeat this process until both players' coins come up heads on the same flip.

fields.name: Cloud Elemental
fields.text:
Flying
Cloud Elemental can block only creatures with flying.
fields.flavor: The soratami surround their sky-castles with living clouds that serve as both sword and shield.

fields.name: Erg Raiders
fields.text: At the beginning of your end step, if Erg Raiders didn't attack this turn, Erg Raiders deals 2 damage to you unless it came under your control this turn.

fields.name: Balance
fields.text: Each player chooses a number of lands they control equal to the number of lands controlled by the player who controls the fewest, then sacrifices the rest. Players discard cards and sacrifice creatures the same way.

fields.name: Hill Giant
fields.flavor: Hill giants are mostly just big. Of course, that does count for a lot.

fields.name: Vizzerdrix
fields.flavor: A bored wizard once created a vizzerdrix out of a bunny and a piranha. He never made *that* mistake again.

fields.name: Iron Star
fields.text: Whenever a player casts a red spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.

fields.name: Aven Cloudchaser
fields.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
When Aven Cloudchaser enters the battlefield, destroy target enchantment.

fields.name: Camouflage
fields.text:
Cast this spell only during your declare attackers step.
This turn, instead of declaring blockers, each defending player chooses any number of creatures they control and divides them into a number of piles equal to the number of attacking creatures for whom that player is the defending player. Creatures those players control that can block additional creatures may likewise be put into additional piles. Assign each pile to a different one of those attacking creatures at random. Each creature in a pile that can block the creature that pile is assigned to does so. (Piles can be empty.)

fields.name: Cyclopean Mummy

fields.name: Greater Good
fields.text: Sacrifice a creature: Draw cards equal to the sacrificed creature's power, then discard three cards.

fields.name: Wall of Wood
fields.text: Defender (This creature can't attack.)

fields.name: Sedge Troll

Sedge Troll gets +1/+1 as long as you control a Swamp.
{B}: Regenerate Sedge Troll.
fields.flavor: The stench in the hovel was overpowering; something loathsome was cooking. Occasionally something surfaced in the thick paste, but my host would casually push it down before I could make out what it was.

fields.name: Jade Statue

"Some of the other guys dared me to touch it, but I knew it weren't no ordinary hunk o' rock."

fields.name: El-Hajjâj
fields.text: Whenever El-Hajjâj deals damage, you gain that much life.

fields.name: Merfolk of the Pearl Trident
fields.flavor: Most human scholars believe that merfolk are the survivors of sunken Atlantis, humans adapted to the water. Merfolk, however, believe that humans sprang forth from merfolk who adapted themselves in order to explore their last frontier.

fields.name: Soulblast
fields.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice all creatures you control.
Soulblast deals damage to any target equal to the total power of the sacrificed creatures.

fields.name: Evacuation
fields.text: Return all creatures to their owners' hands.
fields.flavor: Which is more unsettling: the roar of battle or the silence that follows?

fields.name: Storm Crow
fields.text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
fields.flavor: Storm crow descending, winter unending. Storm crow departing, summer is starting.

fields.name: Fellwar Stone
fields.text: {T}: Add one mana of any color that a land an opponent controls could produce.
fields.flavor:
"What do you have that I cannot obtain?"
—Mairsil, the Pretender

fields.name: Order of the Sacred Torch
fields.text: {T}, Pay 1 life: Counter target black spell.
fields.flavor: A blazing light to drive out the shadows.

fields.name: Circle of Protection: Green
fields.text: {1}: The next time a green source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

fields.name: Eastern Paladin
fields.text: {B}{B}, {T}: Destroy target green creature.
fields.flavor:
"There is no worse enemy. His passion for death doesn't just border on insanity, it wallows in it."
—The Southern Paladin

fields.name: Winter Blast
fields.text: Tap X target creatures. Winter Blast deals 2 damage to each of those creatures with flying.
fields.flavor:
"Blow, winds, and crack your cheeks! rage! blow!"
—William Shakespeare, *King Lear*

fields.name: Braingeyser
fields.text: Target player draws X cards.

fields.name: Warrior's Honor
fields.text: Creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.

fields.name: Elvish Archers
fields.text: First strike
fields.flavor: I tell you, there was so many arrows flying about you couldn't hardly see the sun. So I says to young Angus, "Well, at least now we're fighting in the shade!"

fields.name: Afflict
fields.text:
Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
Draw a card.
fields.flavor: One rarely notices a heartbeat, save when it is stolen.

fields.name: Tidings
fields.text: Draw four cards.
fields.flavor:
"Though the letter was many pages long, I could tell all I needed to know from one look at the messenger's face."
—Barrin, master wizard

fields.name: Wall of Water
fields.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{U}: Wall of Water gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
fields.flavor: A deafening roar arose as the fury of an enormous vertical river supplanted our serenity. Eddies turned into whirling geysers, leveling everything in their path.

fields.name: Bloodfire Colossus
fields.text: {R}, Sacrifice Bloodfire Colossus: It deals 6 damage to each creature and each player.
fields.flavor: It took all its strength to contain the fire within.

fields.name: Cephalid Constable

fields.flavor: Cephalids don't police people. They police loyalties.

fields.name: Lava Axe
fields.text: Lava Axe deals 5 damage to target player or planeswalker.
fields.flavor: "Catch!"

fields.name: Stronghold Assassin
fields.text: {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Destroy target nonblack creature.
fields.flavor: The assassin sees only throats and hears only heartbeats.

fields.name: Polymorph
fields.text: Destroy target creature. It can't be regenerated. Its controller reveals cards from the top of their library until they reveal a creature card. The player puts that card onto the battlefield, then shuffles all other cards revealed this way into their library.
fields.flavor: "Ahh! Opposable digits!"

fields.name: Shatterstorm
fields.text: Destroy all artifacts. They can't be regenerated.
fields.flavor: Chains of leaping fire and sizzling lightning laid waste the artificers' handiwork, sparing not a single device.

fields.name: Earthquake
fields.text: Earthquake deals X damage to each creature without flying and each player.

fields.name: Dragon Engine
fields.text: {2}: Dragon Engine gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
fields.flavor:
"How is it the legged engines seem so much more alive than their wheeled counterparts? Simply, they were born, not made."
—Mishra

fields.name: Fire Elemental
fields.flavor: It treads on feet of coals and strikes with the force of a volcano.

fields.name: Aven Windreader
fields.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
{1}{U}: Target player reveals the top card of their library.
fields.flavor: "The tiniest ripple tells a story ten fathoms deep."

fields.name: Prismatic Ward
fields.text:
Enchant creature

Prevent all damage that would be dealt to enchanted creature by sources of the chosen color.

fields.text: {U}{U}{U}, {T}: Return target permanent to its owner's hand.

"Of course she's at the head of her class. All of her classmates have disappeared."

fields.name: Honor Guard
fields.text: {W}: Honor Guard gets +0/+1 until end of turn.

fields.name: Wall of Spears
fields.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
First strike

"A stick is your friend. A pointed stick is your good friend. An army of pointed sticks is your best friend."
—Onean sergeant

fields.name: Aladdin's Lamp
fields.text: {X}, {T}: The next time you would draw a card this turn, instead look at the top X cards of your library, put all but one of them on the bottom of your library in a random order, then draw a card. X can't be 0.

Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Whenever enchanted creature attacks or blocks, its controller loses 3 life.

"My favorite curses are those that manifest slowly, blackening the soul in ways the victim cannot hope to understand."
—Erissa, bog witch

fields.text:
Enchant creature

fields.flavor: Knights are quick to pledge their loyalty and even quicker to charge into battle.

fields.name: Orcish Artillery

fields.flavor: In a rare display of ingenuity, the Orcs invented an incredibly destructive weapon. Most Orcish artillerists are those who dared criticize its effectiveness.

fields.name: Counsel of the Soratami
fields.text: Draw two cards.
fields.flavor: "Wisdom is not the counting of all the drops in a waterfall. Wisdom is learning why the water seeks the earth."

fields.name: Enormous Baloth
fields.flavor: Its diet consists of fruits, plants, small woodland animals, large woodland animals, woodlands, fruit groves, fruit farmers, and small cities.

fields.name: The Brute
fields.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+0.
{R}{R}{R}: Regenerate enchanted creature.
fields.flavor:
"Union may be strength, but it is mere blind brute strength unless wisely directed."
—Samuel Butler

fields.name: Lifelace

fields.name: Lightning Blast
fields.text: Lightning Blast deals 4 damage to any target.
fields.flavor:
"I'll climb down soon. Don't worry, it's just a thundersto—"
—Former elvish scout

fields.name: Python
fields.flavor:
"How can you claim the gods are merciless when they robbed the snake of its limbs to give the other creatures a sporting chance?"
—Hakim, Loreweaver

fields.name: Rampant Growth
fields.text: Search your library for a basic land card, put that card onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle.
fields.flavor: Rath forces plants from its surface as one presses whey from cheese.

fields.name: Land Leeches
fields.text: First strike
fields.flavor:
"The standard cure for leeches requires the application of burning embers. Alternative methods must be devised should an ember of sufficient size prove more harmful than the leech."
—Vervamon the Elder

fields.name: Fog
fields.text: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.

fields.name: Sylvan Library
fields.text: At the beginning of your draw step, you may draw two additional cards. If you do, choose two cards in your hand drawn this turn. For each of those cards, pay 4 life or put the card on top of your library.

fields.name: Sea Monster
fields.text: Sea Monster can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.
fields.flavor: It's easy to believe the monster is a myth—until you feel three hundred thousand pounds of myth crashing down on your ship.

fields.name: Ankh of Mishra
fields.text: Whenever a land enters the battlefield, Ankh of Mishra deals 2 damage to that land's controller.
fields.flavor: Tawnos finally cracked the puzzle: the strange structures did not house Mishra's malevolent creations but were themselves among his creations.

fields.name: Craw Wurm
fields.flavor: The most terrifying thing about the Craw Wurm is probably the horrible crashing sound it makes as it speeds through the forest. This noise is so loud it echoes through the trees and seems to come from all directions at once.

fields.name: Fervor
fields.text: Creatures you control have haste. (They can attack and {T} as soon as they come under your control.)

fields.name: Northern Paladin

fields.name: Femeref Archers

"They say a Zhalfirin archer can split the eye of a griffin. Nonsense, of course; they have no faith to guide their darts."

fields.name: Rage Weaver
fields.text: {2}: Target black or green creature gains haste until end of turn. (It can attack and {T} this turn.)

There are medicines for all afflictions but idleness.

Flying

"Her voice is justice, clear and relentless."

fields.name: Wild Griffin

fields.flavor:

—King Darien of Kjeldor

fields.name: Gluttonous Zombie
fields.text: Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)

{T}: Add {C}.

Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Flying

Flying

—John Dryden, "The Hind and the Panther"

fields.name: Giant Spider
fields.text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
fields.flavor: While it possesses potent venom, the Giant Spider often chooses not to paralyze its victims. Perhaps the creature enjoys the gentle rocking motion caused by its captives' struggles to escape its web.

fields.name: Lure

Enchant creature

fields.flavor: Her true theft was to steal the soldiers away from their posts.

fields.flavor: "I tell you, there was so many arrows flying about you couldn't hardly see the sun. So I says to young Angus, 'Well, at least now we're fighting in the shade!'"

Enchant creature
All damage that would be dealt to you is dealt to enchanted creature instead.

"Why would I consider penance for my actions when I have so many subjects willing to do it for me?"

fields.flavor: Generations of genetic weeding have given rise to the deviously cowardly Ironclaw clan. To say that Orcs in general are vicious, depraved, and ignoble does not do justice to the Ironclaw.

Players play with their hands revealed.

fields.text:
Enchant artifact
You control enchanted artifact.

Protection from white (This creature can't be blocked, targeted, dealt damage, or enchanted by anything white.)

Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Flying

fields.name: Storm Crow
fields.text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
fields.flavor: Storm crow descending, winter unending. Storm crow departing, summer is starting.

Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Nightmare's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Swamps you control.

fields.text: Target creature gets -5/-0 until end of turn.

"May you decrease like coal upon the hearth . . . Evaporate like water in a pail, Become as little as a linseed-grain . . . And so diminish that you come to nothing."

"Goblins bred underground, their numbers hidden from the enemy until it was too late."
—*Sarpadian Empires*, vol. IV

fields.name: Rampant Growth
fields.text: Search your library for a basic land card, put that card onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle.

—Molimo, maro-sorcerer

{1}{G}{G}: Target creature gains forestwalk until end of turn.

Whenever enchanted creature deals damage, you gain that much life.

fields.text: Choose a color. Target player reveals their hand and discards all cards of that color.

fields.name: Lost Soul

fields.flavor:
". . . The magician drew a ring off his finger . . . , saying: 'It is a talisman against all evil, so long as you obey me.'"
—*The Arabian Nights*,
Junior Classics trans.

fields.name: Tunnel

fields.name: Mind Bend
fields.text: Change the text of target permanent by replacing all instances of one color word with another or one basic land type with another. (For example, you may change "nonblack creature" to "nongreen creature" or "forestwalk" to "islandwalk." This effect lasts indefinitely.)

fields.name: Mishra's War Machine
fields.text:
Banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, Mishra's War Machine deals 3 damage to you unless you discard a card. If Mishra's War Machine deals damage to you this way, tap it.

fields.name: Avatar of Might
fields.text:
If an opponent controls at least four more creatures than you, this spell costs {6} less to cast.
Trample (This creature can deal excess combat damage to the player or planeswalker it's attacking.)
fields.flavor: In their most desperate hour, the elves of Llanowar had one song left to sing.

fields.text: When Staunch Defenders enters the battlefield, you gain 4 life.
fields.flavor: The key to winning any fight is simply staying alive.

fields.name: Necrite
fields.text: Whenever Necrite attacks and isn't blocked, you may sacrifice it. If you do, destroy target creature defending player controls. It can't be regenerated.

fields.name: Polymorph
fields.text: Destroy target creature. It can't be regenerated. Its controller reveals cards from the top of their library until they reveal a creature card. The player puts that card onto the battlefield, then shuffles all other cards revealed this way into their library.

fields.name: Nantuko Disciple

Unanswered prayers are themselves answers.

fields.name: Inferno

fields.name: Wall of Wood

If any creatures with banding a player controls are blocking or being blocked by a creature, that player divides that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
fields.flavor: Whether inspired by fear or by honor, all loyalty lends might.

Up and down,
over and through,
back around—
the joke's on you.

fields.name: Craw Wurm
fields.flavor: The most terrifying thing about the Craw Wurm is probably the horrible crashing sound it makes as it speeds through the forest. This noise is so loud it echoes through the trees and seems to come from all directions at once.

fields.name: Holy Strength

Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+2.

"For my confession they burned me with fire / And found that I was for endurance made."
—*The Arabian Nights*,
trans. Haddawy

fields.name: Fighting Drake

"As we neared, Belfar proclaimed the wall to be made of glass and went forward to prove it. We had no choice but to pull his hands free from where he had touched it, leaving flesh palmprints on the icy wall."

Flying

Dunno how to count no more."

fields.flavor: Not all silences are easily broken.

fields.name: Island Sanctuary

{2}, {T}: Target creature gets +1/+1 for as long as Tawnos's Weaponry remains tapped.
fields.flavor: When war machines became too costly, Tawnos's weaponry replaced them.

fields.name: Angelic Wall
fields.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)

fields.flavor:
"The Ancestor protects us in ways we can't begin to comprehend."
—Mystic elder

fields.name: Balduvian Barbarians
fields.flavor:
"Barbarian raids were a concern to those living in the northwest provinces, but the skyknights never dealt with the problem in a systematic way. They thought of the Balduvians as an 'amusing model' of their forebears' culture."
—*Kjeldor: Ice Civilization*

fields.name: Wrath of Marit Lage
fields.text:
When Wrath of Marit Lage enters the battlefield, tap all red creatures.
Red creatures don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.
fields.flavor:
"Marit Lage lies frozen in a glacier's heart. Still her dreams take form in our world, stealing the heat from our souls."
—Halvor Arenson, Kjeldoran priest

fields.name: Sorceress Queen
fields.text: {T}: Target creature other than Sorceress Queen has base power and toughness 0/2 until end of turn.
fields.flavor:

fields.name: Killer Bees
fields.text:
Flying
{G}: Killer Bees gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
fields.flavor: The communal mind produces a savage strategy, yet no one could predict that this vicious crossbreed would unravel the secret of steel.

fields.name: Wall of Bone
fields.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{B}: Regenerate Wall of Bone. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)
fields.flavor: The Wall of Bone is said to be an aspect of the Great Wall in Hel, where the bones of all sinners wait for Ragnarok, when Hela will call them forth for the final battle.

fields.name: Keldon Warlord
fields.text: Keldon Warlord's power and toughness are each equal to the number of non-Wall creatures you control.

fields.name: Mind Bomb

Count carefully the souls and see that none are lost.
—Vec teaching

fields.name: Redwood Treefolk

fields.name: Elvish Piper

fields.flavor:
From Gaea grew the world, and the world was silent. From Gaea grew the world's elves, and the world was silent no more.
—Elvish teaching

fields.name: Dingus Egg

fields.flavor: Icatia's once-peaceful towns faced increasing attacks from orcs and goblins as the climate cooled. By the time the empire fell, they were little more than armed camps.

fields.flavor: Don't try to outrun one of Dominia's Grizzlies; it'll catch you, knock you down, and eat you. Of course, you could run up a tree. In that case you'll get a nice view before it knocks the tree down and eats you.
